name: Burkley, Appellant, v. Philadelphia et al.

judges: Before Schaffer, C. J., Drew, Linn, Stern, Barnes and Patterson, JJ.
parties: Burkley, Appellant, v. Philadelphia et al.

opinions.text:
Per Curiam,
The decree is affirmed on the opinion of the court below. Costs to be paid by the City of Philadelphia.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: Frederic L. Clark, of Shields, Clark, Brown & Mc-Cown, for appellant.
Michael D. Hayes, Assistant City Solicitor, with him Francis F. Burch, City Solicitor, and Edward B. Soken, for appellee.
Thomas Reath, of Drinker, Biddle & Reath, for Cramp Shipbuilding Co., under Rule 61.
Joseph W. Henderson, of Rawle <& Henderson, for Cit-zens Committee, under Rule 61.
casebody.head_matter:
Burkley, Appellant, v. Philadelphia et al.
Argued September 9, 1940.
Before Schaffer, C. J., Drew, Linn, Stern, Barnes and Patterson, JJ.
Frederic L. Clark, of Shields, Clark, Brown & Mc-Cown, for appellant.
Michael D. Hayes, Assistant City Solicitor, with him Francis F. Burch, City Solicitor, and Edward B. Soken, for appellee.
Thomas Reath, of Drinker, Biddle & Reath, for Cramp Shipbuilding Co., under Rule 61.
Joseph W. Henderson, of Rawle <& Henderson, for Cit-zens Committee, under Rule 61.
September 10, 1940:
